### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation regarding Ollama Installation in Pieces-OS

**Key Points Raised:**

* User is unable to install Ollama due to Pieces-OS running as a snap with limited access to packages like `curl`.
* User has confirmed `curl` is installed on their system but not accessible within the snap environment.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation script attempts to use `curl` within the Pieces-OS snap environment, where it is not available.
* Manually downloading and installing Ollama outside the snap does not resolve the issue as Pieces-OS cannot access it.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is working on a patch to allow Ollama access within the Pieces-OS snap environment.
* Infrastructure updates have been completed, allowing development to resume on the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is not yet resolved as of January 28, 2025.
* The fix is actively being worked on with an expected release in the near future.

**Additional Notes:**

* Manually downloading the models will not resolve the issue as it also affects inference.
* Users are advised to wait for the official fix to be released.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS endpoints, encountering errors like "Connection refused" and "Route not found" on ports 1000 and 39300. This might be related to Pieces OS version upgrades and port changes. Solutions include verifying the correct port (39300), checking if Pieces OS is running, and contacting Pieces support for further assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Update and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop App after updating to PiecesOS 11.0.x, including non-dismissable overlay messages, repeated update prompts, and launch failures.  Suggested solutions include verifying auto-launch settings, updating through the Microsoft Store, and restarting the computer. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and working on improvements.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues and Feature Requests
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage by PiecesOS, potentially linked to internet connectivity or Live Context. Short-term solutions include restarting PiecesOS or disabling Live Context. A database technology replacement in PiecesOS 11.1.0 aims to address these issues. Additionally, users request font customization in Copilot chats, which is planned for an upcoming release.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation Regarding High Memory and CPU Usage in PiecesOS:

**Key Points Raised:**

* High memory and CPU usage by PiecesOS, impacting user experience.
* Some users reporting excessive RAM usage (up to 5GB) and high CPU spikes (120%+).
* Speculation that Live Context feature might contribute to high resource usage.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leaks leading to excessive RAM consumption.
* High CPU usage causing system slowdowns and impacting overall performance.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Database technology replacement in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to address memory and CPU issues.
* Optimize Memory feature to temporarily unload ML models and free up RAM.
* Live Context deactivation as a potential solution to reduce memory consumption.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 release addressing memory and CPU issues is available.
* Community feedback is being collected to assess the effectiveness of the release.
* Further improvements are planned to optimize resource usage.

**Additional Notes:**

* Some users continue to experience high CPU usage even after updating to 11.1.0.
* Live Context is suspected to be a potential factor in high memory consumption.
* The development team is actively working on further optimizations.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Installation Issues:** Allocate immediate resources to address the Ollama installation failures, focusing on dependency conflicts and snap confinement issues within Pieces OS.

**Investigate Pieces OS Connection Problems:** Investigate and resolve the connection issues users are facing with Pieces OS endpoints, specifically on ports 1000 and 39300. Ensure clear communication about port changes in future updates.

**Address Pieces Desktop App Update and Launch Concerns:** Focus on resolving the issues users are experiencing with the Pieces Desktop App after updating to PiecesOS 11.0.x, including non-dismissable overlays, update prompts, and launch failures.

**Improve PiecesOS Resource Management:** Continue optimizing PiecesOS to reduce RAM/CPU usage, particularly in relation to internet connectivity and Live Context. Monitor the effectiveness of the database technology replacement in version 11.1.0.

**Enhance Communication about Known Issues:** Proactively communicate known issues, such as the high resource usage, to manage user expectations and provide potential workarounds while solutions are being developed.
**Implement Font Customization:** Prioritize the implementation of font customization in Copilot chats, as requested by users, to improve user experience and accessibility.
